availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Amos Hobgood (Hopkins County, ky, farm laborer )

body.p: Granville County, North Carolina and Hopkins County, Kentucky, farm laborer. North Carolina native. Son of Sarah Hobhood. Resident of Napp, North Carolina, in 1850. Farm laborer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Household held sixteen enslaved persons in trust in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, North Carolina, Granville County, Napp, p. 170B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 640.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 211B-212A.
"Amos Hobgood (1837-1917)," Find A Grave, Memorial #69662910, accessed October 7, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69662910.
